job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Calgary, AB
pros: Lovely co workers, nice work with youth

cons: Poor leadership, wrong priorities, people are expendable

review_title: Great work, lower pay than hospital
cons: Can be more difficult to negotiate salary/raises

job_title: Casual Support Worker in Calgary, AB
cons: Inequitable pay. The Alex undervalues employees that are loyal and have given years of service. They would rather pay more to attract new employees creating a huge pay gap.
The job can be mentally demanding work

job_title: Mental Health Clinician in Calgary, AB
pros:
-Good at the beginning until they got rid of all the good employees and managers 
-Collaborative before it went bad
cons:
-Poor management 
-For a company who cares for people they did a really poor job taking care of their employees 
-Pushed out racially diverse workers 
-CEO is an awful person and lies

job_title: Fund Development Administrative Assistant in Calgary, AB
pros: (Some of) the staff was incredible. The Alex does great work in the city so knowing you’re making a contribution regardless of your role is fulfilling.
cons: Very disorganized management. Made it hard for me to do my job because of this.

job_title: Community Support Worker in Calgary, AB
pros: The program I am apart of is really well run and everyone is so kind to one another.
cons: not many shifts available to pick up if you're casual

job_title: Social Worker/Case Manager in Calgary, AB
pros: team work. STRONG focus on well-being, mental health, self-care,very understanding. At times, very forward thinking and has developed themselves to be ahead of the curve in many respects when it comes to culture and diversity along with organizational issues.
cons: case load is extensive, management training, extensive growth in a short time - leading to less focus on grass roots as organization becomes an industry leader, growing pains, lack of further career opportunities,

job_title: Residential Care Worker in Calgary, AB
cons: I don't see anything bad working here

pros: cutting edge experience for those new to the field
cons: large case load, burnout, ongoing management issues due to large growth of organization in such a short period. Little oversight.

pros: Benefits are good for a non-profit
cons: If you're outside of the CEO's circle, you might as well not exist. Long hours, no work life balance and overall a bad place to work. CEO and top management end up getting 5-10K bonuses and really don't care about the hard work that front-line workers do.
